ch.phonon

Class Scales

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.phonon.Scales

  • public class Scales
extends java.lang.Object
    The Scales class is a value class that stores a list of DrawableScaleReferences. It provides functions to modify the list container but also handles other essential properties of the scale as their DrawableScaleReference.ActiveState.
    Author:
    phonon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scales()
      Constructs the Scales value container.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DrawableScaleReference chooseScale(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double actualMousePosition)
      This method chooses a scale in finding the first that is reflected by the delivered mouse position in TEMView coordinates.
      DrawableScaleReference findFirstScaleThatContains(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double actualMousePosition)
      This method finds and gives back a reference to the first found DrawableScaleReference that contains the actual mouse position provided in TEMView coordinates.
      DrawableScaleReference getChosenScale()
      After chosing a scale by mouse pointer (see this chooseScale(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double) the chosen state is changed.
      java.util.List<DrawableScaleReference> getScaleReferencesList()
      Get list of associated DrawableScaleReferences
      void newScale(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double actualMousePosition)
      This method generates a new scales and places it on the position provided by the mouse (in picture coordinates - the actual mouse position needs therefore to be calculated by the TEMView.getPictureCoordinates(Point2D) function).
      int size()
      Gives back the total number of scales (active & inactive ones)

    • Method Detail

      • getScaleReferencesList

        public java.util.List<DrawableScaleReference> getScaleReferencesList()
        Get list of associated DrawableScaleReferences
        Returns:
        reference to the list of DrawableScaleReference

      • newScale

        public void newScale(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double actualMousePosition)
        This method generates a new scales and places it on the position provided by the mouse (in picture coordinates - the actual mouse position needs therefore to be calculated by the TEMView.getPictureCoordinates(Point2D) function). All actual active scales are marked as inactive at this moment. The new scale is oriented horizontally around the chosen position.
        Parameters:
        actualMousePosition -

      • chooseScale

        public DrawableScaleReference chooseScale(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double actualMousePosition)
        This method chooses a scale in finding the first that is reflected by the delivered mouse position in TEMView coordinates. When a scale is found, that fits and contains the mouse position it is given back. All other scales are shifted to DrawableScaleReference.ActiveState.INACTIVE state.
        Parameters:
        actualMousePosition -
        Returns:
        first found scale that fits to the mouse position

      • findFirstScaleThatContains

        public DrawableScaleReference findFirstScaleThatContains(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double actualMousePosition)
        This method finds and gives back a reference to the first found DrawableScaleReference that contains the actual mouse position provided in TEMView coordinates.
        Parameters:
        actualMousePosition - the mouse position in temView coordinates to allow the Drawable.contains(int, int) check.
        Returns:
        the first selected Scale

      • getChosenScale

        public DrawableScaleReference getChosenScale()
        After chosing a scale by mouse pointer (see this chooseScale(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double) the chosen state is changed. This function allows to get a reference to the chosen scale.
        Returns:
        chosen scale reference

      • size

        public int size()
        Gives back the total number of scales (active & inactive ones)
        Returns:
        total number of scales
